public class DrawLib
extends java.lang.Object

This Class contains a set of static methods which drawing geometric figures

Constructor Summary
DrawLib()
           
 
Method Summary
static void drawLine(java.awt.Graphics g, int x0, int y0, int x1, int y1, int thickness)
          this method draws a line from (xo, y0) to (x1, y1) with a given thickness by using the Bresenenham algorithm To set the color of the line use Graphics.setColor() before you call the method note: Use a public int or double value ending with thickness or length for the thickness of the line.
static void drawRectangle(java.awt.Graphics g, java.awt.Point center, java.awt.Dimension dimension, java.awt.Color backColor, int border, java.awt.Color borderColor, java.lang.String text, int textHeight, java.awt.Color fontColor)
          This method draws a filled Rectangle with border and text.

drawRectangle

public static void drawRectangle(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                 java.awt.Point center,
                                 java.awt.Dimension dimension,
                                 java.awt.Color backColor,
                                 int border,
                                 java.awt.Color borderColor,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 int textHeight,
                                 java.awt.Color fontColor)
This method draws a filled Rectangle with border and text. If you want no border, set 0. For no text, set "" or null.
Parameters:
center - center of the rectangle
backColor - background color
border - boder thickness
borderColor - border color
textHeight - text height
dimension - Description of the Parameter
g - graphic context
text - Description of the Parameter
fontColor - Description of the Parameter

drawLine

public static void drawLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                            int x0,
                            int y0,
                            int x1,
                            int y1,
                            int thickness)
this method draws a line from (xo, y0) to (x1, y1) with a given thickness by using the Bresenenham algorithm To set the color of the line use Graphics.setColor() before you call the method note: Use a public int or double value ending with thickness or length for the thickness of the line. So the value will be scaled automaticly
Parameters:
x0 - start x
y0 - start y
x1 - end x
y1 - end y
g - graphic context
thickness - line thickness
